summary: This document is a series of email exchanges between defense attorneys Christian Everdell and Mark S. Cohen and federal prosecutors regarding the arrest and upcoming legal proceedings for Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss scheduling her arraignment and bail hearing in the Southern District of New York, coordinating attorney-client contact while she is detained in New Hampshire, and logistical planning for court submissions.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating scheduling and bail application with prosecutors.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on emails regarding scheduling and client contact.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Client of Everdell and Cohen, arrested by the FBI in New Hampshire and facing indictment in SDNY.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: SDNY judge to whom the prosecution plans to submit a scheduling letter regarding Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Jeff
persons.context: Mentioned in the initial arrest notification email as part of the defense team.

connections.description: Co-defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating on scheduling and strategy.
Everdell is part of the legal team representing Maxwell, arranging communication and bail submission.
Cohen is part of the legal team representing Maxwell, copied on all client-related communications.
Engaged in professional correspondence to schedule court appearances, bail hearings, and discuss procedural matters.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The FBI arrested Ghislaine Maxwell in Bradford, New Hampshire. She was to be presented in the District of New Hampshire via remote proceedings.

events.title: Indictment Unsealing
events.description: Prosecutors informed defense counsel of the arrest and attached the indictment and arrest warrant, noting they were seeking formal unsealing in SDNY.

events.title: Scheduling of Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: Prosecution and defense agreed to propose an arraignment and bail hearing for Friday, July 10, 2020, with defense bail submission due Thursday and prosecution reply due Friday.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by the FBI on the morning of July 2, 2020, in Bradford, New Hampshire.
The indictment was provided to her defense attorneys, Christian Everdell and Mark S. Cohen, ahead of its formal unsealing in the Southern District of New York.
The defense planned to make a bail application, requiring coordination with Pretrial Services for an interview while Maxwell was detained in New Hampshire.
The prosecution and defense agreed to schedule Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing for Friday, July 10, 2020, with specific deadlines for written submissions.
The emails show procedural coordination between defense and prosecution regarding speedy trial time exclusions and scheduling before Judge Nathan.
